posts.post_content:
I like how M12 has a big creature at uncommon for each color. [Serra Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Serra Angel) for white, [Belltower Sphinx](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Belltower Sphinx) for blue, this for black, [Volcanic Dragon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Volcanic Dragon) for red, and I'm not sure abot green. [Cudgel Troll](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cudgel Troll) or [Carnage Wurm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Carnage Wurm), maybe?  
But really, this guy is too good for uncommon. I got one in a draft. My opponent did not want to attack me.

Posted By: JFM2796 (7/28/2011 2:22:55 PM)

posts.post_content:
I like that each color has an Uncommon flying power-hitter at five or six.  
Blue: [Belltower Spinx](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Belltower Spinx)  
White: [Serra Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Serra Angel)  
Black: This  
Red: (Okay, this one's at six, but bear with me.) [Volcanic Dragon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Volcanic Dragon)  
and Green, despite not having any really good flying creatures, except things like that one Efreet, has:  
[Stingerfling Spider](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stingerfling Spider), which can kill any of the above mentioned.  
  
Got to hand it to them. They built a good draft set-up.

Posted By: Radagast (7/21/2011 10:53:19 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
[Serra Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Serra Angel) is now the standard angel in 2012, so it's only fitting that she once again faces off against her oldest foe, the Sengir Vampire.  
  
Sengir Vampire is one of those rare cards that was good when magic first started and is still good today. A 4/4 flyer for 5 cmc is pretty good right off the bat, but throw in its "grow" ability and you've got a damn solid critter. Great for general use, great for combo players, great for beating your opponent's face in. What's not to love?  
  
...actually the art could use some work.
posts.html:
Serra Angel is now the standard angel in 2012, so it's only fitting that she once again faces off against her oldest foe, the Sengir Vampire.

Great for general use, great for combo players, great for beating your opponent's face in. What's not to love?

...actually the art could use some work.

Posted By: Totema (5/14/2012 12:20:48 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
White: Serra Angel  
Blue: Phantasmal Dragon  
Black: Sengir Vampire  
Red: Volcanic Dragon  
Green: Cudgel Troll.  
  
When you think about what each card does and how much each card costs, each of those two attributes makes perfect sense for the cards' colors and for the cards' speeds. Even Volcanic Dragon makes perfect sense for Red at 6 cost. Yes, it's a little slower to cast. Red has traditionally had creatures cost a bit more for what they do than other colors have (see [Sabretooth Tiger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=4085), [Elvish Archers](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=3975), and [Youthful Knight](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=5274)). Well guess what. He casts a turn later than the other flyers I mentioned above, but he attacks at the same game tempo. They wait a turn to attack. He casts a turn later, but attacks right when he comes out. That sort of fits Red. The creatures cost a bit more, but they're often faster, or at least more tenacious.  
  
Green's creatures are basically alwa... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
